channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for SC

item.title: Report X-2024031298
item.description:
Report X-2024031298

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Delivery driver brought package back to station and it was leaking material. Driver bagged the package. QA notified manager and manager placed bagged package in a hazmat bag and in a hazmat tote. Tote was brought to the HazMat cage and placed in the HWPA. DescribePack: Pail was cracked on the side near the bottom. Crack approximately 4 inches. DurationRel: 7 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazmat bag then in a hazmat tote and brought to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024031100
item.description:
Report X-2024031100

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: SPARTANBURG
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in trailer during the unloading process. Package was discovered already damaged and leaking. Package was placed in a lined hazmat tote and taken to the damaged hazmat cage, where it was repackaged into a damaged hazmat salvage drum. DescribePack: External packaging (cardboard box) was stained and wet. Inspection shows a plastic bag suspended by carboard liners on all sides. Plastic bag had leaked from tied point. Bag contained a metal can which had been taped shut but had leaked from the lid. Contents of metal can is an absorbent and a glass 1QT bottle of Nitric Acid 70% which had broken, leaking all contents into absorbent and external packaging. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately removed from service flow and placed inside damaged hazmat cage. Internal packaging and absorbent prevented external release other than the box being visibly discolored and moist.

item.title: Report X-2024030815
item.description:
Report X-2024030815

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-26T15:10:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-11
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was removed from trailer and brought to load side door 26. Package was placed on the floor. Ops Manager Jacob Sellers noticed package was wet and called for QA HazMat Specialist. Package was bagged and placed in a HazMat Tote. Tote was brought to the HazMat cage and placed on appropriate pallet for Flammable Liquids. DescribePack: Small pin hole on bottom of one of the cans causing a slow leak. No indication of puncture from outside of packaging. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was bagged and placed in a Hazmat tote and brought to the Hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024030786
item.description:
Report X-2024030786

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: FORT MILL
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2024030786, X-2024030831: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS DROPPED OFF AT VSA AFTER ONLY A SECOND DELIVERY ATTEMPT. THERE WAS A WHITE GRANULAR/POWDER SUBSTANCE COMING OUT OF THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE FAILURE WAS IN THE BODY OF THE DRUM. THE BOTTOM OF THE DRUM WAS BUSTED/CRACKED OPEN CAUSING A LARGE AMOUNT OF SPILLAGE. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: THE BUSTED DRUM WAS TAKEN OUT OF THE BOX AND PLACED IN A LINED DRUM.
